intro: Porophyllum oblanceolatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils, and it produces small, yellowish to brownish flowers. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, with a rough, hairy texture, and it is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Porophyllum oblanceolatum is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used by indigenous communities for various traditional purposes.
